meanings.definition: A comic performer, typically wearing exaggerated clothing and makeup.
meanings.sent1: The clowns made everyone laugh at the circus.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of clowns performing tricks at the birthday party.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the clowns' funny faces.
meanings.sent4: Her colorful outfit made her look like a clown in the office.
meanings.sent5: The clown's red nose and big shoes were hard to miss.

meanings.definition: A person who acts in a silly or ridiculous way.
meanings.sent1: Don't be a clown and take this seriously.
meanings.sent2: He always acts like a clown to make his friends smile.
meanings.sent3: She pretended to be a clown to cheer up her friend.
meanings.sent4: His behavior at the party was that of a clown.
meanings.sent5: The class clown made everyone burst into laughter.

meanings.definition: To act or behave in a playful or silly manner.
meanings.sent1: The children love to clown around in the playground.
meanings.sent2: Stop clowning and focus on your work.
meanings.sent3: She would often clown to make her sister laugh.
meanings.sent4: The students decided to clown during the break.
meanings.sent5: He would clown to lighten the mood during tense moments.
